description.para: NRF24L01 general command definitions
These commands should be shifted out over MOSI directly after asserting CSN Format is NRF24L01_CMD_x where x is the name assigned to the command by the datasheet

briefdescription.para: Register read 0b000XXXXX where XXXXX = 5 bit Register Map Address.
Register write 0b001XXXXX where XXXXX = 5 bit Register Map Address.
Read RX payload.
Write TX payload.
Flush TX FIFO.
Flush RX FIFO.
Reuse TX payload.
(De)Activates R_RX_PL_WID, W_ACK_PAYLOAD, W_TX_PAYLOAD_NOACK features
No operation (used for reading status register for example)

description.para: NRF24L01 special feature command definitions

These commands are only valid after the ACTIVATE command has been send to toggle on the NRF24L01 special features Format is NRF24L01_FEATURE_CMD_x where x is the name assigned to the command by the datasheet

briefdescription.para: Read RX-payload width for the top R_RX_PAYLOAD in the RX FIFO.
Write ACK payload 0b10101XXX where XXX = 3 bit pipe identifier.
Write TX payload and disable AUTOACK.

description.para: NRF24L01 register address definitions
Format is NRF24L01_REG_ADDR_r where r is the name assigned to the register by the datasheet

briefdescription.para: Configuration register address.

Enable RX addresses register address.

description.para: NRF24L01 special feature register address definitions

briefdescription.para: Enable dynamic payload length register address.

sectiondef.header: Dynamic Payload Length Enable Configuration Register (DYNPD)

briefdescription.para: Minimum time the CE pin must be asserted for.
Maximum time required for TX start-up from STANDBY_I mode, RX start-up from STANDBY_I mode, and when changing from TX to RX or RX to TX.
Time required for carrier detect to update the register.
Maximum time required to start-up from power down mode.
Each TX FIFO entry is 32 bytes wide.
The TX FIFO is 3 entries deep.
Each TX FIFO entry is 32 bytes wide.
The RX FIFO is 3 entries deep.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates to true if the given pipe is for transmitting bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Specifies if dynamic transmit acknowledgements are enabled or disabled. When DTA is enabled, the PTX can set the NO_ACK flag by transmitting using the W_TX_PAYLOAD_NOACK command. This allows the PTX tp immediately transition to STANDBY-I instead of waiting for an ACK from the PRX to conserve power

Hardware initialization function pointer which should be used to configure the hardware before communication is attempted.

detaileddescription.para:
Responsibilities
Configure IRQ MCU input. IRQ output pin is active-low. Interrupt pin should be triggered on negative-edge. Pull-up resistor needed

parameterdescription.para: : Pointer to user-defined hardware configuration struct
-> Success
-> Fail

memberdef.definition: typedef NRF24L01_FPTR_RTN_T(* nrf24l01_spi_exchange_fptr_t) (uint8_t command, uint8_t *rx_data, uint8_t *tx_data, uint8_t len, void *user_ptr)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uint8_t command, uint8_t *rx_data, uint8_t *tx_data, uint8_t len, void *user_ptr)
memberdef.name: nrf24l01_spi_exchange_fptr_t

briefdescription.para: SPI Bus exchange function pointer which should be mapped to the platform specific write functions of the user.

parameterdescription.para: : NRF24L01-specific command byte which should be sent before rx_data and/or tx_data
: Pointer to data buffer into which data which will be read. Implementation must handle the case where this value is NULL. When non-NULL, this buffer must have a size of 'len'
: Pointer to data buffer in which data to be written is stored. Implementation must handle the case where this value is NULL. When non-NULL, this buffer must have a size of 'len'
: Number of bytes of data to be read/written.
: Pointer to user-defined hardware configuration struct
-> Success
-> Fail

briefdescription.para: Set the state of Chip enable GPIO function pointer.

parameterdescription.para: : Desired state of the chip enable GPIO
: Pointer to user-defined hardware configuration struct
-> Success
-> Fail

briefdescription.para: Microsecond delay function pointer which should be mapped to the platform specific delay function of the user.

parameterdescription.para: : Number of microseconds to delay
-> Success
-> Fail
